reference_no_of_permission_being_relied_: 240306FUL-Installation of air source heat pump; adiabatic cooler; condensers (watercooled VRF) heat pumps within new plant enclosure (following of removal of existing condensers (air-cooled VRF)); air handling units at roof level; relocation of photovoltaic (PV) panels to southeast corner; and associated alterations.
site_name: Acton Town Hall, Everyone Active Acton Centre
description: Installation of air source heat pump; adiabatic cooler; condensers (water cooled VRF) heat pumps within new plant enclosure (following of removal of existing condensers (air-cooled VRF)); air handling units at roof level; relocation of photovoltaic (PV) panels to southeast corner; and associated alterations. (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): 1025-ASC-PL-01 (LOCATION PLAN); 1025-ASC-PL-02 (BLOCK PLAN AND EXISTING SITE PLAN); 1025-ASC-PL-03 (PROPOSED SITE PLAN); 1025-ASC-PL-04 (EXISTING SITE PLAN ENLARGEMENT); 1025-ASC-PL-05 (PROPOSED SITE PLAN ENLARGEMENT); 1025-ASC-PL-06 (EXISTING AND PROPOSED ELEVATIONS 1); 1025-ASC-PL-07 (EXISTING AND PROPOSED ELEVATIONS 2); 1025-ASC-PL-08 (EXISTING AND PROPOSED ELEVATIONS 3); 1025-ASC-PL-09 (EXISTING AND PROPOSED ELEVATIONS 4); AIR HANDLING UNIT SHEETS (AIR SYSTEMS); PL01-100 DESIGN AND ACCESS STATEMENT (ZEBRA ARCHITECTS); 23352 V 1.0 HERITAGE STATEMENT (ECUS)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development hereby approved shall be as per those described in the submitted application form and plans listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the host property and local area, in accordance with Policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013). | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023). | Suitable precautions shall be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements shall be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason:  : To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).
